body_html:
contrib/layers and contrib/learn are APIs at different levels of
abstraction. They will be moved to TensorFlow core and will be part of
TensorFlow and hence supported indefinitely. If you're worried about
support and alignment with TensorFlow, this is your best bet.

contrib/slim as well as PrettyTensor are actively maintained by
teams/people at Google. Both will likely not disappear.

I cannot speak to external projects' prospects. tflearn.org is an
unfortunate name collision, we have no involvement in the project.
On Mon, Aug 15, 2016 at 17:08 Sherry Moore notifications@github.com wrote:

Thanks for the great summary. We are in fact in the process of
consolidating. Martin will elaborate.

—

contrib/layers and contrib/learn are APIs at different levels of
abstraction. They will be moved to TensorFlow core and will be part of
TensorFlow and hence supported indefinitely. If you're worried about
support and alignment with TensorFlow, this is your best bet.

contrib/slim as well as PrettyTensor are actively maintained by
teams/people at Google. Both will likely not disappear.

I cannot speak to external projects' prospects. tflearn.org is an
unfortunate name collision, we have no involvement in the project.
